comments:
I am contributing 2 VMs from 2 different plugin.xmls using the extension point org.eclipse.jdt.launching.vmInstalls. And that works fine, BUT when I add a library to one of them I get an exception. I found out that if I only contribute the one VM with the library it works. 


!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.addVMExtensions(JavaRuntime.java:1536)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.initializeVMs(JavaRuntime.java:2479)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.getVMInstallTypes(JavaRuntime.java:489)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.InstalledJREsBlock.fillWithWorkspaceJREs(InstalledJREsBlock.java:902)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.InstalledJREsBlock.createControl(InstalledJREsBlock.java:371)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.JREsPreferencePage.createContents(JREsPreferencePage.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferencePage.createControl(PreferencePage.java:233)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog.createPageControl(PreferenceDialog.java:1403)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$12.run(PreferenceDialog.java:1162)
......
What build are you using? The stack trace does not match code in HEAD (i.e. 3.2 RC5).

Created an attachment (id=42490)
patch

This is an error with nested loops. The inner loop incorrectly used the outer loop's counter when making an assignment (filling an array).

E-mailed binary plug-in to Marcelo for testing. He verified the patch works.

Marking as RC6 candidate. Without this fix, the new extension point is broken.
Adding my +1, CC'ing Darin(S), John(A), and McQ for RC6 approval.
oh the dangers of using i and j...verified +1
